sif3.common.provider
Interface Provider

All Known Implementing Classes:
AUDataModelProvider, BaseProvider, StudentPersonalProvider
public interface Provider

This class defines the methods a provider must implement to fit with this framework. The interface is independent from the Data Model and underlying infrastructure components. It defines the core function SIF3 specifies for a consumer.


Note:
Because this framework allows to be run under Java 6 some of the types in various methods use "Object" instead of the template notation. This is because Java 6 doesn't allow a 'new T()' and therefore the interface avoids the template notation to not break the implementation where a constructor for an Object might be required. This may change in future versions of the framework.

Author:
Joerg Huber

Method Detail

retrievByPrimaryKey

java.lang.Object retrievByPrimaryKey(java.lang.String resourceID,
                                     SIFZone zone,
                                     SIFContext context)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            PersistenceException
This method returns the object with the given resourceID in the location defined by the zone and context. If the object with the given resourceID doesn't exist then null is returned.

Parameters:
resourceID - The resourceID of the object that shall be returned.
zone - Can be Null (default Zone)
context - Can be Null (default Context)
Returns:
The entity for this resourceID. Null if entity with given resourceID does not exist.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Persistance Store could not be accessed successfuly. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.

createSingle

java.lang.Object createSingle(java.lang.Object data,
                              SIFZone zone,
                              SIFContext context)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                     PersistenceException
This method creates the given object with the data provided in the given zone and context. If the object cannot be created then either an exception is raised or null is returned.

Parameters:
data - The data of the actual Object to be created. It may or may not hold the resourceID and the provider may or may not accept it. It is up to the implementation to make that decision. The final resourceID is returned as part of the returned object.
zone - The Zone from which the request is being issued. Can be Null (default Zone)
context - The Context for which the object shall be created. Can be Null (default Zone)
Returns:
The object that is created. It may hold additional data than the one provided.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Persistance Store could not be accessed successfuly. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.

updateSingle

boolean updateSingle(java.lang.Object data,
                     java.lang.String resourceID,
                     SIFZone zone,
                     SIFContext context)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            PersistenceException
This method updates the object given by its resourceID in the given zone for the given context.

Parameters:
data - The actual object (i.e. Student). It holds the values of the object that need to be updated. It can either hold the full object or only parts of the object that needs updating.
resourceID - The Id of the object to be updated.
zone - The Zone from which the request is being issued. Can be Null (default Zone)
context - The Context for which the object shall be updated. Can be Null (default Zone)
Returns:
TRUE: Entity is updated. FALSE: Entity does not exist.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Persistance Store could not be accessed successfuly. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.

deleteSingle

boolean deleteSingle(java.lang.String resourceID,
                     SIFZone zone,
                     SIFContext context)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            PersistenceException
Removed the object with the given resourceId in the given zone for the given context.

Parameters:
resourceID - The Id of the object to be removed.
zone - The Zone from which the request is being issued. Can be Null (default Zone)
context - The Context for which the object shall be removed. Can be Null (default Zone)
Returns:
TRUE: Entity is removed. FALSE: Entity does not exist.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Persistance Store could not be accessed successfuly. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.

retrieve

java.lang.Object retrieve(SIFZone zone,
                          SIFContext context,
                          PagingInfo pagingInfo)
                          throws PersistenceException,
                                 UnsupportedQueryException
This method is used to retrieve any number of objects. This is achieved in terms of 'paging' through the list of objects. The consumer is expected to provide paging information to tell the provider which objects in the list shall be returned. The first page has the number 0.

Parameters:
zone - The Zone from which the request is being issued. Can be Null (default Zone)
context - The Context for which the objects shall be returned. Can be Null (default Zone)
pagingInfo - Page information to determine which results to return. Null = Return all (NOT RECOMMENDED!).
Throws:
UnsupportedQueryException - The query provided with this request is not supported (NOT YET IMPLEMENTED FUNCTIONALITY)
PersistenceException - Persistence Store could not be accessed successfully. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.

createMany

java.util.List<OperationStatus> createMany(java.lang.Object data,
                                           SIFZone zone,
                                           SIFContext context)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                  PersistenceException
This method will create many objects in one call. The 'data' parameter is a collection-style object that is defined in the data model (i.e. StudentPersonals which is a collection of StudentPersonal).

Parameters:
data - The 'collection' object. Each object in that collection will be created.
zone - The Zone from which the request is being issued. Can be Null (default Zone)
context - The Context for which the objects shall be created. Can be Null (default Zone)
Returns:
List with Status and IDs for each created object, or Status and Error for each object. Null if there was an unknown error.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Persistance Store could not be accessed successfuly. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.

updateMany

java.util.List<OperationStatus> updateMany(java.lang.Object data,
                                           SIFZone zone,
                                           SIFContext context)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                  PersistenceException
This method will update many objects in one call. The 'data' parameter is a collection-style object that is defined in the data model (i.e. StudentPersonals which is a collection of StudentPersonal). Each object in the collection can either hold the full object or only parts of the object that needs updating.

Parameters:
data - The 'collection' object. Each object in that collection will be updated.
zone - The Zone from which the request is being issued. Can be Null (default Zone)
context - The Context for which the objects shall be updated. Can be Null (default Zone)
Returns:
List with Status and IDs for each updated object, or Status and Error for each object. Null if there was an unknown error.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Persistance Store could not be accessed successfuly. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.

deleteMany

java.util.List<OperationStatus> deleteMany(java.util.List<java.lang.String> resourceIDs,
                                           SIFZone zone,
                                           SIFContext context)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                  PersistenceException
This method removes all objects in the resourceIDs list in one hit.

Parameters:
resourceIDs - A list of resourceId for the objects to be removed.
zone - The Zone from which the request is being issued. Can be Null (default Zone)
context - The Context for which the objects shall be removed. Can be Null (default Zone)
Returns:
List with Status and IDs for each removed object, or Status and Error for each object. Null if there was an unknown error.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Persistance Store could not be accessed successfuly. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.

getMarshaller

MarshalFactory getMarshaller()
Returns a marshaller applicable for this data model supported with this provider.

getUnmarshaller

UnmarshalFactory getUnmarshaller()
Returns an unmarshaller applicable for this data model supported with this provider.

getSingleObjectClassInfo

ModelObjectInfo getSingleObjectClassInfo()
Returns the information for the 'single object'. The returned object holds the name of a 'single object' (i.e StudentPersonal) and the physical class this maps to for the data model this provider supports.

Returns:
See Desc.

getMultiObjectClassInfo

ModelObjectInfo getMultiObjectClassInfo()
Returns the information for the 'collection-style object'. The returned object holds the name of a 'collection-style object' (i.e StudentPersonal) and the physical class this maps to for the data model this provider supports.

Returns:
See Desc.

finalise

void finalise()
This method is called when a provider shuts down. Can be used to clean-up internally held resources etc.
